Buruh Subang Tolak Kenaikan 100 Persen Iuran BPJS Ketenagakerjaan
06 Nov 2019, 19:26 by Ruslan Efendi


Buruh Subang Tolak Kenaikan 100 Persen Iuran BPJS Ketenagakerjaan

KBRN, Subang : Ratusan buruh yang tergabung dalam Aliansi Buruh Subang (ABS), di antaranya KASBI, FSPMI, SPMKB, SPG Yountek, dan Forum Buruh Perempuan Subang melakukan aksi unjuk rasa ke Kantor DPRD Kabupaten Subang, Rabu (6/11/2019).
Dalam aksi unjukrasa ratusan buruh Subang tersebut, Koordinator lapangan aksi unjukrasa ABS Murdan dalam orasinya menyampaikan sejumlah tuntutan diantaranya, penolakan kenaikan iuran BPJS Ketenagakerjaan 100 persen, dan menuntut kenaikan upah minimum sektoral 20 persen di tahun 2020.
"Kami menolak dengan tegas, dengan naiknya iuran BPJS hingga 100 persen, tentunya sangat memberatkan kaum buruh, dan kenaikan iuran BPJS tersebut tidak sebanding dengan kenaikan upah Kabupaten, dan kami menolak kenaikan upah di bawah UMK, sekaligus menolak adanya upah sektor padat karya," ujar Murdan.
Selain itu, massa buruh juga mengkritisi kinerja Dinas Tenaga Kerja dan Transmigrasi (Disnakertrans) Kabupaten Subang yang dinilai buruk, dan Murdan juga menegaskan, menolak gaji murah dan mendesak agar DPRD segera mengambil sikap dengan menolak 100 persen akan rencana kenaikan iuran BPJS Ketenagakerjaan.
"Pemerintah seharusnya pro terhadap buruh, dan kami juga sangat menyayangkan buruknya kinerja Disnakertrans Kabupaten Subang," terangnya.
Murdan menyatakan bahwa kaum buruh akan terus berjuang agar nasib buruh ada perubahan, dan tentunya pun menolak 100 persen kenaikan iuran BPJS Ketenagakerjaan.
“Kami tegaskan akan terus berjuang agar nasib buruh ada perubahan. Jadi sampai titik darah penghabisan kami menolak 100 persen kenaikan iuran  BPJS Ketenagakerjaan," tegas Murdan.
Murdan menambahkan, saat ini buruh hanya diperas tenaganya oleh perusahaan, tetapi di gaji dengan upah murah.
“Kami minta pemerintah segera menyelesaikan kenaikan upah minimum sektoral di tahun 2020. Kami juga minta upah minimum sektoral tahun 2020 naik 20 persen,” pungkasnya.
Aksi unjukrasa buruh ini pun, mendapatkan pengawalan ketat dari pihak kepolisian yang dipimpin langsung Kapolres Subang AKBP Teddy Fanani.

Subang Workers Reject 100 Percent Increase in BPJS Employment Contribution
Nov 6, 2019, 19:26 by Ruslan Efendi


Subang Workers Reject 100 Percent Increase in BPJS Employment Contribution

KBRN, Subang: Hundreds of workers who are members of the Subang Labor Alliance (ABS), including KASBI, FSPMI, SPMKB, SPG Yountek, and the Subang Women's Workers Forum held a demonstration to the Subang Regency DPRD Office, Wednesday (11/06/2019) .
In the demonstration of hundreds of Subang workers, ABS Murdan's field coordinator of the demonstration action Murdan in his speech conveyed a number of demands including, rejection of an increase in BPJS Employment contributions of 100 percent, and demanded a 20 percent sectoral minimum wage increase in 2020.
"We firmly reject, with the increase in BPJS contributions up to 100 percent, of course very burdensome to the workers, and the increase in BPJS contributions is not comparable to the increase in Regency wages, and we reject the increase in wages below the UMK, while at the same time rejecting labor-intensive sector wages," Murdan said.
In addition, the mass of workers also criticized the performance of the Subang Regency Manpower and Transmigration Office (Disnakertrans) which was considered bad, and Murdan also stressed, rejecting cheap salaries and urging the DPRD to immediately take a stand by rejecting 100 percent of the BPJS Manpower contribution increase plan.
"The government should be pro-workers, and we also deeply regret the poor performance of the Subang District Manpower and Transmigration Office," he explained.
Murdan stated that the workers would continue to struggle so that the workers' fate would change, and of course also refused 100 percent increase in BPJS Employment contributions.
"We emphasize that we will continue to fight so that the fate of workers will change. So until the last drop we reject the 100 percent increase in BPJS Employment contributions, "Murdan said.
Murdan added, currently workers are only extorted by the company, but in salaries with low wages.
"We ask the government to immediately complete the sectoral minimum wage increase in 2020. We also ask that the sectoral minimum wage in 2020 increase by 20 percent," he concluded.
The workers' demonstration also received strict escort from the police led directly by Subang Police Chief AKBP Teddy Fanani.
